name: setNumber
content:
Sets the number for the specified screen element.

Your apps will sometimes need to change, or clear, the numbers displayed on screen elements*. `setNumber()` can be used to update the number on a textInput, textLabel, button or slider screen element.

*The slider design element was contributed by Mike and Mitchell Schmidt.

examples.name: Example: Click Counter
examples.description: Update the number on a button with every click.

examples.name: Example: Where is the mouse click?
examples.description: Demonstrate setting the number on a slider. Assumes sliders named xPositionSlider and yPositionSlider have been placed on the screen in design mode.

palette_params.name: id
palette_params.description: The unique identifier for the screen element. Must begin with a letter, contain no spaces, and may contain letters, digits, - and _.

palette_params.name: number
palette_params.description: The number displayed within the screen element.

return_value: No return value. Modifies screen only.
short_description: Sets the number for the specified screen element.
tips: - You cannot use `setText()` with sliders which require a number to be set.
